timeline.author: valfirst
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -42,6 +42,15 @@ boolean assertElementNumber(String businessDescription, String systemDescription, List elements, int number); + /** + * Assert that the number of elements in elements collection is equal to number + * @param description description of elements in the elements collection + * @param elements collection being verified + * @param number expected number of elements in the element collection + * @return whether the number of elements in elements is equal to number + */ + boolean assertElementsNumber(String description, List elements, int number);

timeline.bodyText: what's the reason for this method?
timeline.author: ikalinin1

replies.bodyText: I'll need this in my next PR, additionally it's replacement for a deprecated method
replies.author: uarlouski

timeline.author: ikalinin1

replies.bodyText:
Checked it and it turned out not to be properly aligned with comparison rule message, so we get as a result the following:
[Expected: number of elements is a value equal to <...> Actual: <...>]
replies.author: uarlouski

replies.bodyText: [Expected: number of elements is a value less than or equal to <...> Actual: <...>]
replies.author: uarlouski
